title: GAMEBREAKING /REMAKE BUG
body:
So here I am playing ranked just chillin then less than 3minutes in our TF dies to Lulu mid. Me being salty I walk off to the bathroom and chill there for a few seconds. When I return to my computer, in the chat is a message from the league client to all players saying something like

"You have 60 seconds left to /remake due to player DC" something like that I can't remember too well lol!

Even though no one in the game DCed not to mention our TF died prior to the /remake message. Me being worried that we would lose I /remake coz you know I ain't risking a match with a TF that dies to mid Lulu in the first 2.5 minutes.

so TL:DR  --- Could /remake despite no DC's and even a death before /remake message.

here is screenshot of prove and I hope riot sees this and fixes as it is quite gamebreaking 
http://i.imgur.com/MYj727j.jpg
http://i.imgur.com/MYj727j.jpg

replies.body: i think gp went afk, look at his cs

I believe they got rid of the first blood thing, cause i was watching bjergsen when they realised the other team would remake they 5 man dive bot turret for a kill but that didnt stop it. Not sure how that game got remade with no afk though
that is only when the afk'er is the one who died, if it is someone else on the team it doesn't affect /remake

> [{quoted}](name=Narwhal,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=oyIPKw9v,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-07-12T04:58:16.900+0000)
>
> that is only when the afk'er is the one who died, if it is someone else on the team it doesn't affect /remake

No. Check your facts.

For the billionth time.

**YOU CAN STILL REMAKE IF SOMEONE IS AFK BEFORE A FIRST BLOOD**

It is very likely that the GP was afk (after getting 1 CS) and if he stopped moving before the 1:30 mark, so he hit the 90 second counter at 3 minutes (which is possible, with attacks turned on he could easily have actually afk'd in lane and gotten a CS) then he is counted as AFK according to the system, and the remake is possible.

Of course without seeing a Replay, we can't tell if this is an actual bug or not.
